Description: Part of the side of an ovoid marl pottery vase, decorated in red paint on the exterior with remains of a boat motif, preserving two cabins, part of the hull with oars, the base of the standard, and the tip of the overhanging tree. Two s-motifs appear above the boat.
Curator's comments: Petrie’s Decorated ware. Marked ‘559 one piece’ in ink on interior. Published in G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 598.
